paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the molecular determinants of interactions between the N-terminal domain and the transmembrane core of the hERG K+ channel, focusing on the effects of specific mutations on channel gating. Variants in the KCNH2 gene, specifically V3C, Y542C, and G546C, are mentioned in the context of functional studies.

functional_data.summary: The V3C mutation in the N-terminal segment of the hERG channel impairs the ability of the recombinant eag domain to restore normal deactivation kinetics.

key_quotes: Effect of the N1-135/YFP recombinant fragment on deactivation kinetics of hERG channels truncated in the N-terminus (Δ2-370; panel B), lacking only the eag domain (Δ2-135; panel C) or carrying a single point V3C mutation (black sphere) at the beginning of the amino terminus (V3C, panel D).

functional_data.summary: The Y542C mutation in the S4–S5 linker prevents the recombinant eag domain from restoring normal deactivation kinetics.

key_quotes: Deactivation slowing in the presence of the recombinant domain is not observed with channels carrying a specific Y542C point mutation in the S4–S5 linker.

functional_data.summary: The G546C mutation was generated for study but specific functional effects are not detailed in the text.

key_quotes: To generate the single point mutants V3C, Y542C and G546C, site-directed mutagenesis was performed using the PCR-based overlap method.

challenges: No patient-level data or penetrance information was provided in the paper.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily focuses on functional studies of specific mutations in the KCNH2 gene without providing clinical or penetrance data.
